newsitem.title: JAPAN: Yaohan ask-only despite court protection denial.
newsitem.headline: Yaohan ask-only despite court protection denial.

text.p: Yaohan Japan Corp shares were ask-only on Friday morning despite a denial by the supermarket chain operator late on Thursday that it was not considering seeking court protection from creditors as rumoured.
As of 0053 GMT, the shares were ask-only at 128 yen, compared to the 143 yen close on Wednesday.
"I've never dreamed of seeking court mediation from creditors, or been prepared for it," company president Mitsumasa Wada told a late evening news conference in Tokyo.

Earlier on Thursday, the mass circulation daily Yomiuri Shimbun reported on its wire service that Yaohan Japan was in talks with financial firms on possible changes in the retailer's restructuring plan and that it may be forced to apply for court mediation.

"Despite the denial, the fact remains that Yaohan's financial health is not very good and market participants are playing with the shares, seeing how far they fall," a broker at a "Big Four" brokerage said.

Market participants and analysts said there was a widespread view that the Yaohan may run into difficulties in gaining much-needed support from its creditor banks to restructure its business, which could worsen its financial situation.
